page.title: 16DRUMOAK'S FAMOUS SONS
page.content: The{'lad o pairts'}was a Scots term referring to a man brought up in a small rural community and rising to a position of some importance in life. One such from Drumoak was{James {Gregory (1638-75)}inventor of the reflecting telescope.An important mathematician and graduate of Aberdeen University he taught at St Andrew's and Edinburgh Universities. Another interesting if less well known character was Doric writer{James H} {Smythe.}Educated at Gordon's College, Aberdeen, he travelled in America and Australia before coming to farm at Barrowsgate,Drumoak. He had a book of Doric verse published in 1933 - "The Blethers o Barrowsgate". A man of some wit he wrote his own epitaph ending with the line: {Aneth this steen there lies a blether 'Beneath this stone lies a windbag'.
